Structs/Validator.html#/s:10Validation9V.name: readable
Structs/Validator.html#/s:10Validation9V.abstract: Readable name explaining what this Validator does. Must be suitable for placing after is and `is not.

Structs/Validator.html#/s:10Validation9V.name: validate(_:)
Structs/Validator.html#/s:10Validation9V.abstract: Validates the supplied ValidationData, throwing an error if it is not valid.

Structs/Validator.html#/s:10Validation9V.name: ascii
Structs/Validator.html#/s:10Validation9V.abstract: Validates that all characters in a String are ASCII (bytes 0..<128).

Structs/Validator.html#/s:10Validation9V.name: alphanumeric
Structs/Validator.html#/s:10Validation9V.abstract: Validates that all characters in a String are alphanumeric (a-z,A-Z,0-9).

Structs/Validator.html#/s:10Validation9V.name: characterSet(_:)
Structs/Validator.html#/s:10Validation9V.abstract: Validates that all characters in a String are in the supplied CharacterSet.

Structs/Validator.html#/s:10Validation9V.name: count(_:)
Structs/Validator.html#/s:10Validation9V.abstract: Validates that the data’s count is within the supplied ClosedRange.

Structs/Validator.html#/s:10Validation9V.name: count(_:)
Structs/Validator.html#/s:10Validation9V.abstract: Validates that the data’s count is less than the supplied upper bound using PartialRangeThrough.

Structs/Validator.html#/s:10Validation9V.name: count(_:)
Structs/Validator.html#/s:10Validation9V.abstract: Validates that the data’s count is less than the supplied lower bound using PartialRangeFrom.

Structs/Validator.html#/s:10Validation9V.name: count(_:)
Structs/Validator.html#/s:10Validation9V.abstract: Validates that the data’s count is within the supplied Range.

Structs/Validator.html#/s:10Validation9V.name: email
Structs/Validator.html#/s:10Validation9V.abstract: Validates whether a String is a valid email address.

Structs/Validator.html#/s:10Validation9V.name: in(_:)
Structs/Validator.html#/s:10Validation9V.abstract: Validates whether an item is contained in the supplied array.

Structs/Validator.html#/s:10Validation9V.name: in(_:)
Structs/Validator.html#/s:10Validation9V.abstract: Validates whether an item is contained in the supplied array.

Structs/Validator.html#/s:10Validation9V.name: nil
Structs/Validator.html#/s:10Validation9V.abstract: Validates that the data is nil. Combine with the not-operator ! to validate that the data is not nil.

Structs/Validator.html#/s:10Validation9V.name: range(_:)
Structs/Validator.html#/s:10Validation9V.abstract: Validates that the data is within the supplied ClosedRange.

Structs/Validator.html#/s:10Validation9V.name: range(_:)
Structs/Validator.html#/s:10Validation9V.abstract: Validates that the data is less than the supplied upper bound using PartialRangeThrough.

Structs/Validator.html#/s:10Validation9V.name: range(_:)
Structs/Validator.html#/s:10Validation9V.abstract: Validates that the data is less than the supplied lower bound using PartialRangeFrom.

Structs/Validator.html#/s:10Validation9V.name: range(_:)
Structs/Validator.html#/s:10Validation9V.abstract: Validates that the data is within the supplied Range.

Structs/Validations.html#/s:10Validation.name: init(_:)
Structs/Validations.html#/s:10Validation.abstract: Create an empty Validations struct. You can also use an empty array [].

Structs/Validations.html#/s:10Validation.name: add(_:at:_:)
Structs/Validations.html#/s:10Validation.abstract: Adds a new Validation at the supplied key path and readable path.

Structs/Validations.html#/s:10Validation.name: add(_:at:_:_:)
Structs/Validations.html#/s:10Validation.abstract: Adds a custom Validation at the supplied key path and readable path.

Structs/Validations.html#/s:10Validation.name: add(_:_:)
Structs/Validations.html#/s:10Validation.abstract: Adds a new Validation at the supplied key path. Readable path will be reflected.

Structs/Validations.html#/s:10Validation.name: add(_:_:_:)
Structs/Validations.html#/s:10Validation.abstract: Adds a new custom Validation at the supplied key path. Readable path will be reflected.

Structs/BasicValidationError.html#/s:10V.name: path
Structs/BasicValidationError.html#/s:10V.abstract: Key path the validation error happened at

Structs/BasicValidationError.html.name: BasicValidationError
Structs/BasicValidationError.html.abstract: Errors that can be thrown while working with validation

Structs/Validations.html.name: Validations
Structs/Validations.html.abstract: Holds zero or more validations for a Validatable model.

Protocols/ValidatorType.html#/s:10Valida.name: validatorReadable
Protocols/ValidatorType.html#/s:10Valida.abstract: Readable name explaining what this Validator does. Suitable for placing after is and is not.

Protocols/ValidatorType.html#/s:10Valida.name: validate(_:)
Protocols/ValidatorType.html#/s:10Valida.abstract: Validates the supplied ValidationData, throwing an error if it is not valid.

Protocols/Validatable.html#/s:10Validati.name: validations()
Protocols/Validatable.html#/s:10Validati.abstract: The validations that will run when validate() is called on an instance of this class.

Protocols/Validatable.html#/s:10Validati.name: validate()
Protocols/Validatable.html#/s:10Validati.abstract: Validates the model, throwing an error if any of the validations fail.

Protocols/Validatable.html.name: Validatable
Protocols/Validatable.html.abstract: Capable of being validated. Conformance adds a throwing validate() method.

Protocols/ValidationError.html.name: ValidationError
Protocols/ValidationError.html.abstract: A validation error that supports dynamic key paths. These key paths will be automatically

Protocols/ValidatorType.html.name: ValidatorType
Protocols/ValidatorType.html.abstract: Capable of validating validation data or throwing a validation error.

Functions.html#/s:10Validation2oooiAA9Va.abstract: Combines two Validators, succeeding if either of the Validators does not fail.
